cleaned_text: Article contents Science and Medicine in Imperial China—The State of the Field Published online by Cambridge University Press: 23 March 2011 Extract Sinology and the history of science have changed practically beyond recognition in the past half-century. Both have become academic specialisms, with their own departments, journals, and professional societies. Both have moved off in new directions, drawing on the tools and insights of several disciplines. Although some sinologists still honor no ambition beyond explicating primary texts, on many of the field's frontiers philology is no more than a tool.
